openadk.library.impl
Class JDBCQueue

java.lang.Object
  openadk.library.impl.JDBCQueue
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAgentQueue
public class JDBCQueue
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAgentQueue

The JDBCQueue class is a JDBC-based implementation of an Agent Local Queue.

initialize

public void initialize(Zone zone,
                       java.util.Properties props)
                throws ADKQueueException
Initialize the queue

Specified by:
initialize in interface IAgentQueue
Parameters:
agent - The agent that owns the queue. Each agent has one queue per zone to which it is connected.
zone - The zone that owns the queue. Each zone to which an agent is connected is represented by its own queue.
props - Implementation-specific initialization properties (e.g. location of the queue, user authentication parameters, etc.)
Throws:
ADKQueueException

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Is the queue ready? A queue is ready when it has been successfully initialized and shutdown has not been called.

nextMessage

public SIFMessageInfo[] nextMessage(byte msgType,
                                    byte direction)
                             throws ADKQueueException
Gets the next available group of messages

Specified by:
nextMessage in interface IAgentQueue
Parameters:
msgType - The message type, or MSG_ANY to return the next available groups of messages regardless of type. Message type codes are defined by MSG_ constants defined by the IAgentQueue interface.
direction - Specifies whether the message is incoming or outgoing; one of the following: IAgentQueue.INCOMING, IAgentQueue.OUTGOING, or IAgentQueue.ALL
Throws:
ADKQueueException

getCount

public int getCount(byte msgType,
                    byte direction)
             throws ADKQueueException
Counts the total number of messages in the queue

Specified by:
getCount in interface IAgentQueue
Parameters:
msgType - The message type, or MSG_ANY to return the number of all messages regardless of type. Message type codes are defined by MSG_ constants defined by the IAgentQueue interface.
direction - Specifies whether the message is incoming or outgoing; one of the following: IAgentQueue.INCOMING, IAgentQueue.OUTGOING, or IAgentQueue.ALL
Throws:
ADKQueueException

getStatistic

Gets a queue statistic

Specified by:
getStatistic in interface IAgentQueue
Parameters:
id - Identifies the statistic to return. Identifiers are enumerated by STAT_ constants defined by the IAgentQueue interface.
Returns:
A statistic object
